document.heading: Health Services Planning Program Re-establishment Act of 1996

history.narrative: Law 11-191, the “Health Services Planning Program Re-establishment Act of 1996,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 11-086, which was referred to the Committee on Human Services. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 4, 1996, and July 3, 1996, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on July 22, 1996, it was assigned Act No. 11-347 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 11-191 became effective on April 9, 1997.
